title: Why do they have to make it so hard to find the correct version of a mod?

title: Why is it that when I download a Minecraft map from the internet, all of the structures are flat?
self_text: When I download a Minecraft map from the internet and open it in-game, all of the structures are flat, as if they were made with only flat blocks. However, I have seen videos of people playing on these same maps without any issues. What could be causing this problem?  I tried downloading different versions of the map, but none of them work. The map I downloaded was for version 1.16.5. I am currently running version 1.19.4. Could this be the issue?

title: Minecraft Bedrock Server - How do I get it to show up in the server list?

I have opened port 19132 on my router (and firewall) but for whatever reason, I cannot see my server listed when searching through the "Add Server" section of the game.   The server is running and my friend has been able to connect to it using my IP address + port number.   Any advice?

title: Minecraft crashes with a black screen after the "loading" animation
self_text: I've tried everything. I am running the latest version of Optifine, and have allocated 8GB RAM to it. The crash happens randomly, but is usually during loading chunks. I will get to the loading animation, then my monitor turns off for like half a second before going back to the game in a black screen. It doesn't freeze, as Alt + F4 works fine.  I can run other games at max settings without issues. My specs are below; CPU: Intel Core i5-9600K GPU: RTX 2070 Super RAM: 16GB Motherboard: ASRock Z390 Pro4 Operating System: Windows 10   Is there anything I haven't thought of?

title: Can anyone help me with a weird glitch?

I tried using /summon minecraft:armor_stand ~ ~ ~ {Equipment:[{},{},{},{}],ShowArms:true,ArmorDropChances:[0.2F,0.2F,0.2F,0.2F]} but that didn't seem to do anything, also tried putting armor onto it manually by right clicking but that still doesn't change anything.  Is there something else I should try?

title: Bedrock is better than java, deal with it
self_text: I'm not trying to start a flame war or anything, but bedrock is just way more fun and better for my own enjoyment. If you don't like bedrock that's fine but don't be rude about it.  Bedrock has so many features that Java doesn't have like the ability to import worlds from other platforms.

title: What's the difference between 'Java Edition', 'Bedrock Edition', and 'Legacy Console Editions'?
self_text: I understand that Java is the original, Bedrock can be played on multiple platforms, but what are Legacy?
